ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting on cultivated plants. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.3.1_0: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate or urinate while standing,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.4_0: If one is not sick, one should not defecate or urinate while standing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.5_0: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates or urinates while standing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk73:1.9_0: The training rule on the thirteenth offense is finished.
